N/AParks Canada AgencyThings to do - Sable Island National Park ReserveContains Covid AlertThings to doSable Island National Park Reserve is a place to be awed by the power of nature. It is an extremely isolated location, and access to it is determined by constraints of weather and geography. Visitor experience opportunities are similar to other remote national parks in Canada, where there are few visitor facilities and the wilderness of the site constitutes an important feature of the experience.2020-04-03T00:00:00ZenThings to do - Sable Island National Park Reservehttps://www.pc.gc.ca/en/pn-np/ns/sable/activ

Environment and natural resourcesEnvironment and Climate Change CanadaAmherst Point Migratory Bird SanctuaryContains Covid AlertNotice; Importance of the sanctuary: migratory birds and other wildlife; History; Landscape; Map of the area; Planning your visit; Key facts about Amherst Point Migratory Bird Sanctuary; Related links; Contact informationAmherst Point Migratory Bird Sanctuary (MBS) lies five km southwest of Amherst at the head of the Bay of Fundy. It was established in 1947 with the agreement of the landowners. However, to afford permanent habitat protection, the land was later acquired by the Canadian Wildlife Service (1973–1974) and designated as a component of the Chignecto National Wildlife Area. The landscape is a mosaic of ponds, marshes, forests and old farm fields.2020-03-31T00:00:00ZenAmherst Point Migratory Bird Sanctuaryhttps://www.canada.ca/en/environment-climate-change/services/migratory-bird-sanctuaries/locations/amherst-point.htmlgeneral public

N/AParks Canada AgencyKejimkujik National Park and National Historic SiteContains Covid AlertThere are many sides to Kejimkujik National Park and National Historic Site. Inland, old growth hemlock, sugar maple and yellow aspen trees border warm-water lakes with quartzite shores. Kejimkujik Seaside, a separate landscape, juxtaposes with colourful barrens, granite cobbles and white-sand beaches. The land also tells the tale of the Mi’kmaw, carved in stone and illuminated through story and legend. Paddle the waters, hike the trails and discover the rich diversity of Kejimkujik.2020-03-27T00:00:00ZenKejimkujik National Park and National Historic Sitehttps://www.pc.gc.ca/en/pn-np/ns/kejimkujik

N/AParks Canada AgencyThings to do - Port-Royal National Historic SiteContains Covid AlertThings to doStep into the unique environment of a reconstructed early 17th century French colony, interacting with costumed interpreters who answer questions and point out details about construction techniques and the daily lives and skills of the Habitation’s residents. In this unique place carved out of the wilderness, learn about the beginnings of European colonization and settlement, and the French settlers’ amiable, important relationship with the Mi'kmaq people.2020-04-02T00:00:00ZenThings to do - Port-Royal National Historic Sitehttps://www.pc.gc.ca/en/lhn-nhs/ns/portroyal/activ

N/AParks Canada AgencyWrecks of HMS Erebus and HMS Terror National Historic SiteContains Covid AlertIn 1845, explorer Sir John Franklin set sail from England with two ships, HMS Erebus and HMS Terror, in search of a Northwest Passage across what is now Canada's Arctic. The ships and crews vanished, prompting a massive search that continues to this day. A breakthrough was made in September 2014 when an expedition led by Parks Canada discovered the wreck of HMS Erebus. This discovery lead to the creation of the Wrecks of HMS Erebus and HMS Terror National Historic Site of Canada.2020-03-20T00:00:00ZenWrecks of HMS Erebus and HMS Terror National Historic Sitehttps://www.pc.gc.ca/en/lhn-nhs/nu/epaveswrecks

Environment and natural resourcesEnvironment and Climate Change CanadaVaseux Lake Migratory Bird SanctuaryContains Covid AlertNotice; Importance of the sanctuary: migratory birds and other wildlife; Landscape; Map of the area; Planning your visit; Key facts about Vaseux Lake Migratory Bird Sanctuary; Related links; Contact informationVaseux Lake Migratory Bird Sanctuary (MBS) is situated 5 km south of Okanagan Falls on Highway 97 in the Okanagan Valley of southern British Columbia. Vaseux Lake is in the Osoyoos-Arid Biotic Area, which is a northern extension of the Great Basin Desert.The MBS was originally established to provide protection to Trumpeter Swans. Canada Geese use the site extensively and nest in numbers exceeding 200 on Hatfield Island.2020-03-27T00:00:00ZenVaseux Lake Migratory Bird Sanctuaryhttps://www.canada.ca/en/environment-climate-change/services/migratory-bird-sanctuaries/locations/vaseux-lake.htmlgeneral public

N/AParks Canada AgencyFort Anne National Historic SiteContains Covid AlertStep foot onto Canada’s oldest National Historic Site and one of the most hotly contested pieces of land on the entire continent at Fort Anne. For centuries, a succession of Scottish, French, First Nations and English settlers clashed over this prize on the banks of Nova Scotia’s Annapolis River. Today, visitors can walk the earthen walls, explore the 1797 Officers’ Quarters Museum and soak up centuries of Canadian history.2020-03-20T00:00:00ZenFort Anne National Historic Sitehttps://www.pc.gc.ca/en/lhn-nhs/ns/fortanne

Environment and natural resourcesEnvironment and Climate Change CanadaGeorge C. Reifel Migratory Bird SanctuaryContains Covid AlertNotice; Importance of the sanctuary: migratory birds and other wildlife; Landscape; Map of the area; Planning your visit; Key facts about George C. Reifel Migratory Bird Sanctuary; Related links; Contact informationGeorge C. Reifel Migratory Bird Sanctuary (MBS) is situated 5 km south of Vancouver, at the northern end of Westham Island in the Fraser River estuary. The sanctuary is named in honour of George C. Reifel, a nature enthusiast and conservationist who purchased land in the 1920s to create a private hunting retreat. Ownership was transferred to the Crown in the 1960s to create the MBS.2020-03-27T00:00:00ZenGeorge C. Reifel Migratory Bird Sanctuaryhttps://www.canada.ca/en/environment-climate-change/services/migratory-bird-sanctuaries/locations/george-c-reifel.htmlgeneral public
